page.shortlink: api objects session object get sql credentials method
page.description: Returns the SQL username and password used for SQL connections.
page.prototype: Context.Session.GetSQLCredentials as L (ByRef Username as C, ByRef Password as C)

argument.name: Username
argument.description: The variable to receive the value of the SQL username.

argument.name: Password
argument.description: The variable to receive the value of the SQL password.

return.name: result
return.description: Always returns .t.. Check *[link:Context.Session.CallResult.Success@./index.xml#section1_CallResult]* before using the return value.

page.discussion: Context.Session.GetSQLCredentials() method gets the current user name and password for SQL connections in the current session. [Context.Session.SetSQLCredentials()] must previously have been called. Check *[link:Context.Session.CallResult.Success@./index.xml#section1_CallResult]* before using the return value.
page.example:
<%a5 dim UsernameIn as c = "ThisIsMyUsername" dim PasswordIn as c = "ThisIsMyPassword" dim UsernameOut as c = "" dim PasswordOut as c = "" ? "Original username: " + UsernameIn + "
" ? "Original password: " + PasswordIn + "
" ? "
" Context.Session.SetSQLCredentials(UsernameIn,PasswordIn) if Context.Session.CallResult.Success ? "Credentials have been set into the session
" ? "
" Context.Session.GetSQLCredentials(UsernameOut,PasswordOut) if Context.Session.CallResult.Success ? "Retrieved username: " + UsernameOut + "
" ? "Retrieved password: " + PasswordOut+ "
" ? "
" if (UsernameIn == UsernameOut) .and. (PasswordIn == PasswordOut) then ? "TEST PASSED" else ? "TEST FAILED" end if else ? "Error getting credentials" end if else ? "Error setting credentials" end if %>
